title: Paleo Herb-Crusted Pork Chops
description: Bone-in pork chops seared and finished with a fragrant herb crust of rosemary, thyme, and garlic for a golden, crisp exterior and juicy interior. Fast pan-to-oven method yields a rich savory flavor with bright lemon and a touch of olive oil—perfect for a paleo weeknight dinner.

ingredients.notes: zest 1 tsp and juice about 1 tbsp
optional for finishing flavor; omit for strict paleo if preferred
total for seasoning; adjust to taste
chopped and sprinkled at the end

steps.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove pork chops from the refrigerator and pat them dry with paper towels; season both sides with half of the salt and all of the pepper. Let sit at room temperature while you prepare the herb crust.
In a shallow bowl combine almond meal, chopped rosemary, thyme, minced garlic, mustard powder, lemon zest, remaining salt, and a small pinch of pepper. Stir to evenly distribute herbs and crumbs.

Brush a thin layer of olive oil (or a light smear of ghee) on both sides of each pork chop to help the crust adhere. Press each chop into the herb-almond mixture, coating both sides and the edges, pressing firmly to form an even crust.

Heat a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat and add the remaining olive oil. When oil is shimmering, place the pork chops in the pan without crowding and sear undisturbed until a golden crust forms on the first side.
Flip the chops and sear the second side for about one minute to develop color. Spoon any quick pan juices over the tops and transfer the skillet to the preheated oven to finish cooking.

Roast in the oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part reads 145°F (63°C) for slightly pink, juicy chops or up to 150°F (66°C) if you prefer less pink—this typically takes 8–10 minutes depending on thickness.

Remove the skillet from the oven and transfer chops to a cutting board; tent loosely with foil and rest for 4 minutes to allow juices to redistribute. While resting, squeeze fresh lemon juice over the chops and sprinkle chopped parsley if using.
